description: Creates a new container recipe. Container recipes define how images are configured, tested, and assessed.

parameters.name: containerType
parameters.description: The type of container to create.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the container recipe.

parameters.name: semanticVersion
parameters.description: The semantic version of the container recipe. This version follows the semantic version syntax.

parameters.name: components
parameters.description: Components for build and test that are included in the container recipe. Recipes require a minimum of one build component, and can have a maximum of 20 build and test components in any combination. (dict) --- Configuration details of the component. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component. parameters (list) --- A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe. (dict) --- Contains a key/value pair that sets the named component parameter. The name of the component parameter to set. Sets the value for the named component parameter. (string) ---

nested_params.name: componentArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

nested_params.name: parameters
nested_params.description: A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the component parameter to set.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: Sets the value for the named component parameter.

parameters.name: instanceConfiguration
parameters.description: A group of options that can be used to configure an instance for building and testing container images. image (string) --- The base image for a container build and test instance. This can contain an AMI ID or it can specify an Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) Parameter Store Parameter, prefixed by ssm:, followed by the parameter name or ARN. If not specified, Image Builder uses the appropriate ECS-optimized AMI as a base image. blockDeviceMappings (list) --- Defines the block devices to attach for building an instance from this Image Builder AMI. (dict) --- Defines block device mappings for the instance used to configure your image. deviceName (string) --- The device to which these mappings apply. ebs (dict) --- Use to manage Amazon EBS-specific configuration for this mapping. encrypted (boolean) --- Use to configure device encryption. deleteOnTermination (boolean) --- Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device. iops (integer) --- Use to configure device IOPS. kmsKeyId (string) --- Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device. snapshotId (string) --- The snapshot that defines the device contents. volumeSize (integer) --- Use to override the device's volume size. volumeType (string) --- Use to override the device's volume type. throughput (integer) --- For GP3 volumes only --- The throughput in MiB/s that the volume supports. virtualName (string) --- Use to manage instance ephemeral devices. noDevice (string) --- Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

nested_params.name: image
nested_params.description: The base image for a container build and test instance. This can contain an AMI ID or it can specify an Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) Parameter Store Parameter, prefixed by ssm:, followed by the parameter name or ARN. If not specified, Image Builder uses the appropriate ECS-optimized AMI as a base image.

nested_params.name: blockDeviceMappings
nested_params.description: Defines the block devices to attach for building an instance from this Image Builder AMI.

nested_params.name: deviceName
nested_params.description: The device to which these mappings apply.

nested_params.name: ebs
nested_params.description: Use to manage Amazon EBS-specific configuration for this mapping.

nested_params.name: deleteOnTermination
nested_params.description: Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyId
nested_params.description: Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device.

nested_params.name: snapshotId
nested_params.description: The snapshot that defines the device contents.

nested_params.name: volumeSize
nested_params.description: Use to override the device's volume size.

nested_params.name: volumeType
nested_params.description: Use to override the device's volume type.

nested_params.name: virtualName
nested_params.description: Use to manage instance ephemeral devices.

nested_params.name: noDevice
nested_params.description: Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

parameters.name: parentImage
parameters.description: The base image for the container recipe.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags that are attached to the container recipe. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: targetRepository
parameters.description: The destination repository for the container image. Specifies the service in which this image was registered. The name of the container repository where the output container image is stored. This name is prefixed by the repository location. For example, <repository location url>/repository_name.

nested_params.name: service
nested_params.description: Specifies the service in which this image was registered.

nested_params.name: repositoryName
nested_params.description: The name of the container repository where the output container image is stored. This name is prefixed by the repository location. For example, <repository location url>/repository_name.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure idempotency of the request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency in the Amazon EC2 API Reference. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: requestId
nested_items.description: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

nested_items.name: clientToken
nested_items.description: The client token that uniquely identifies the request.

nested_items.name: containerRecipeArn
nested_items.description: Returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that the request created.
